text: Shade/blind type, color, and openness factor matches submittals and finish schedule
Control type (manual chain, clutch, motorized) matches drawings and client requirement
Drapery track material, color, and pleat type confirmed (for curtains)
Safety compliance documents (e.g., chain tensioners, child-safety devices) included
Mounting type (inside jamb, surface, ceiling recessed) coordinated with ceiling/wall finish
Power rough-in location coordinated and voltage confirmed for motorized units
Any light gap mitigation requirements confirmed with architect/interior designer
Mounting brackets securely fastened to blocking or substrate
Shades/blinds level, aligned, and operate smoothly
Chain tensioners or wand controls installed as per manufacturer specs
Drapery moves smoothly on track, overlaps correctly, and returns properly
Motor powered and controlled by wall switch, remote, or integrated control system
Programming complete for grouped, preset, or scene control
Shades/drapery free from creases, damage, misalignment
Closeout package submitted: warranties, operation manual, maintenance care
